posts._title: Luchino Visconti – Il gattopardo AKA The Leopard (1963)
posts.title: Il gattopardo
posts.excerpt: Luchino Visconti’s “Il Gattopardo” is an epic on the grandest possible scale. The film recreates, with nostalgia, drama, and opulence, the tumultuous years of Italy’s Risorgimento, when the aristocracy lost its grip and the middle classes rose and formed a unified, democratic Italy. Burt Lancaster stars as the aging prince watching his culture and fortune …

posts.title: Sarmasik
posts.excerpt: SYNOPSIS/PLOT: When the ship’s owner goes bankrupt, the crew learns there is a lien on the ship and that key crew members must stay on board. Six men trapped aboard a ship sailing to Egypt.

posts._title: Thorold Dickinson – The Arsenal Stadium Mystery (1939)
posts.title: The Arsenal Stadium Mystery
posts.excerpt: IMDb user:There are several reasons to relish this curio. It was an apprentice work by Thorold Dickinson, the Hitchcock assistant and cutter who would shoot “Gaslight” and “The Queen of Spades” before becoming Britain’s first professor of film. It is one of the earliest sports movies to feature real sportsmen – acting very woodenly, as …

posts.title: Kanzenna yugi
posts.excerpt: In recent years, director Toshio Masuda has worked on the international stage with action-oriented movies such as Tora! Tora! Tora! and the Space Cruiser Yamato films. posts.title: Low Life

posts._title: Willi Forst – Maskerade AKA Masquerade in Vienna (1934)
posts.title: Maskerade
posts.excerpt: Review: “Maskerade” is the second film directed by Willi Forst. While the ‘Vienna film’ had been popular since the early 1930s not least due to Forst’s work as an actor and singer, it was “Maskerade” that brought the genre to a probably never surpassed high point. The plot, set in Vienna around 1900, seems to …
